body_html:
Seeing similar issues:

  • If I install from the wheels, I get a segfault on import
  • If I build from source, I get a segfault on teardown (dtors for globals), but it seems to run fine until then
  • Using the pure python protobuf lib (either by not installing the cpp impl or setting the env var) eliminates the issue

Both segfaults seem to involve hash maps in protobuf, though that may be a red herring---could be memory corruption caused by something else.

Poking around in gdb but if anyone has ideas on how to debug let me know.

Both segfaults seem to involve hash maps in protobuf, though that may be a red herring---could be memory corruption caused by something else.
Poking around in gdb but if anyone has ideas on how to debug let me know.
body:
Seeing similar issues:
- If I install from the wheels, I get a segfault on import
- If I build from source, I get a segfault on teardown (dtors for globals), but it seems to run fine until then
- Using the pure python protobuf lib (either by not installing the cpp impl or setting the env var) eliminates the issue

Both segfaults seem to involve hash maps in protobuf, though that may be a red herring---could be memory corruption caused by something else.

Poking around in gdb but if anyone has ideas on how to debug let me know.
